back: CSS Flexbox is a one-dimensional layout model that arranges elements in rows or columns within a container.

front: What are the two axes defined by the Flex Model?
back: The main axis and the cross axis.

front: What does the flex-direction property do?
back: It sets the direction of the main axis in a flex container.

front: What is the default value of flex-direction?
back: row
It reverses the items in the row.
It aligns the flex items vertically.
It reverses the order of the flex items vertically.

front: What does the flex-wrap property control?
back: It determines how flex items wrap within the container to fit the available space.

front: What is the default value of flex-wrap?
back: nowrap
It wraps items when they exceed the width of the container.
It wraps flex items in reverse order.
A shorthand for flex-direction and flex-wrap.

front: What does flex-flow: column wrap-reverse; mean?
back: It sets the main axis direction to column and wraps items in reverse order.
It aligns child elements along the main axis.
Aligns items to the start of the main axis.
Aligns items to the end of the main axis.
Centers items along the main axis.
Distributes items evenly with no space at the ends.
Distributes items evenly with space before the first and after the last item.
Distributes items with equal spacing between and around them.

front: What does the align-items property control?
back: It distributes items along the cross axis.
Centers items along the cross axis.
Aligns items to the start of the cross axis.
Stretches items to fill the cross axis.
